page.title: 13Hafod Primary School
page.content: The school is over 100 years old. The building is stone and brick with a slate roof.It has a large playground which is separated from the river Rhonddas by a high wall. This year it has been enlarged because the old infants school,a separate building,has been demolished. There are 105 pupils in the school aged from 3 to 11 and divided into 4 classes.There is a headteacher who teaches the nursery in the mornings,three teachers and a nursery assistant.Another teacher comes in the afternoon for the nursery and there is a violin teacher and a remedial reading teacher. In the mornings the secretary attends to the office work.The morning lessons are mainly maths and english, with a variety of subjects in the afternoon.A caretaker and his assistant keep the school clean.(Karen Spencer-Hafod)
